answers.answer: I'm only going to speak to your A1C as I am a diabetic and that is what my knowledge includes. You should speak with your doctor regarding the other results. An A1C of 6.3 puts you in the prediabetic category. (6.5 is diabetic). This is an opportunity to slow the progression of your diabetes. I would recommend losing any weight you need to lose, and continuing the good work with exercise. You say you eat a " healthy diet"  but I would suggest learning about carbs and how they affect your blood sugar (getting a meter and testing periodically to see if you can stay under 140 at two hours after your meal). Your initial A1C was into the diabetic range, and you have lowered that, but this means you need to continue to monitor your blood sugar to make store it stays in range with diet and exercise.

question: Hello friendsI provide some checked items that are not into preferred reference ranges, hope to get an appropriate recommendations from Doctors or health specialists or some advises from experienced individuals,In blow are the items with the checking record date:---------------- - -January 2008----------------- - -HDL-CHOL = (33) reference range is (35 - 100)MCH =           (31.7) reference range is (27.0 – 31.0)Occult Blood = (+) reference range is (NEGATIVE)---------------- - -January 2010----------------- - -Hb A1C = (6.6) reference range is (4.8 – 6.0)Glucose (NaF) = (134) reference range is (74 – 100)Urice acid = (6.9) reference range is (2.4 – 7.0)HDL-CHOL = (28) reference range is (35 - 100)LDL-Cal = (63.4) reference range is (70 - 160)MCH = (31.8) reference range is (27 – 31.0)MCHC = (35.1) reference range is (31.0 – 35.0)Acetone = (+) reference range is (NEGATIVE)Occult Blood = (+) reference range is (NEGATIVE)---------------- - -March 2010----------------- - -Uric acid = (7.2) reference range is (2.4 – 7.0)---------------- - -June 2010----------------- - -Hb A1C = (6.3) reference range is (4.8 – 6.0)Glucose (NaF) = (129) reference range is (74 – 100)Uric acid = (7.5) reference range is (2.4 – 7.0)HDL-CHOL = (32) reference range is (35 - 100)Total Bilirubin = (1.3) reference range is (0.3 – 1.2)MCH = (31.7) reference range is (27 – 31.0)Wbc count = (12.80) reference range is (4.0 – 11.0)Occult Blood = (+) reference range is (NEGATIVE)Bacteria = (few) reference range is (NEGATIVE)In addition to the above, I am 37 old, do not drink or smoke at all, I do exercise almost daily since and swim at least once a week, following a healthy diet, I do not use any medication for sugar control, I used some herbal capsules such as cinnamon, and marmodica charantia for about 3 months and I have stopped it now, this is to get a clear answer after reading the above check-up results,Any feedbacks will be highly appreciated
title: Test blood results with references (diabetic type2)
